verses.verse: (Lev. 10:14, 15, 17) They shall eat those things with which the atonement was made, to consecrate and to sanctify them; (Ex. 12:43; Lev. 22:10) but an outsider shall not eat them, because they are holy.

And if any of the flesh of the consecration offerings, or of the bread, remains until the morning, then (Ex. 12:10; 23:18; 34:25; Lev. 7:18; 8:32) you shall burn the remainder with fire. It shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
“Thus you shall do to Aaron and his sons, according to all that I have commanded you. (Lev. 8:33-35) Seven days you shall consecrate them.

And you (Heb. 10:11) shall offer a bull every day as a sin offering for atonement. (Ex. 30:26-29; 40:10, 11) You shall cleanse the altar when you make atonement for it, and you shall anoint it to sanctify it.
Seven days you shall make atonement for the altar and sanctify it. And the altar shall be most holy. (Num. 4:15; Hag. 2:11-13; Matt. 23:19) Whatever touches the altar must be holy.
(The Daily Offerings) “Now this is what you shall offer on the altar: (Num. 28:3-31; 29:6-38; 1 Chr. 16:40; Ezra 3:3) two lambs of the first year, (Dan. 12:11) day by day continually.
One lamb you shall offer (Ezek. 46:13-15) in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight.
With the one lamb shall be one-tenth of an ephah of flour mixed with one-fourth of a hin of pressed oil, and one-fourth of a hin of wine as a drink offering.

And the other lamb you shall (1 Kin. 18:29, 36; 2 Kin. 16:15; Ezra 9:4, 5; Ps. 141:2) offer at twilight; and you shall offer with it the grain offering and the drink offering, as in the morning, for a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.

This shall be (Ex. 30:8) a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the door of the tabernacle of meeting before the LORD, (Ex. 25:22; 33:7, 9; Num. 17:4) where I will meet you to speak with you.
And there I will meet with the children of Israel, and the tabernacle (Ex. 40:34; 1 Kin. 8:11; 2 Chr. 5:14; Ezek. 43:5; Hag. 2:7, 9) shall be sanctified by My glory.
So I will consecrate the tabernacle of meeting and the altar. I will also (Lev. 21:15) consecrate both Aaron and his sons to minister to Me as priests.
(Ex. 25:8; Lev. 26:12; Num. 5:3; Deut. 12:11; Zech. 2:10; (John 14:17, 23; Rev. 21:3)) I will dwell among the children of Israel and will (Gen. 17:8; Lev. 11:45) be their God.
And they shall know that (Ex. 16:12; 20:2; Deut. 4:35) I am the LORD their God, who (Lev. 11:45) brought them up out of the land of Egypt, that I may dwell among them. I am the LORD their God.
(The Altar of Incense) “You shall make (Ex. 37:25-29) an altar to burn incense on; you shall make it of acacia wood.
A cubit shall be its length and a cubit its width—it shall be square—and two cubits shall be its height. Its horns shall be of one piece with it.
And you shall overlay its top, its sides all around, and its horns with pure gold; and you shall make for it a molding of gold all around.
Two gold rings you shall make for it, under the molding on both its sides. You shall place them on its two sides, and they will be holders for the poles with which to bear it.
You shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
And you shall put it before the (Ex. 26:31-35) veil that is before the ark of the Testimony, before the (Ex. 25:21, 22) mercy seat that is over the Testimony, where I will meet with you.
“Aaron shall burn on it (Ex. 30:34; 1 Sam. 2:28; 1 Chr. 23:13; Luke 1:9) sweet incense every morning; when (Ex. 27:20, 21) he tends the lamps, he shall burn incense on it.
And when Aaron lights the lamps at twilight, he shall burn incense on it, a perpetual incense before the LORD throughout your generations.
You shall not offer (Lev. 10:1) strange incense on it, or a burnt offering, or a grain offering; nor shall you pour a drink offering on it.

And (Lev. 16:3-34) Aaron shall make atonement upon its horns once a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonement; once a year he shall make atonement upon it throughout your generations. It is most holy to the LORD.”
(The Ransom Money) Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

(Ex. 38:25, 26; Num. 1:2; 26:2; 2 Sam. 24:2) “When you take the census of the children of Israel for their number, then every man shall give (Num. 31:50; (Matt. 20:28; 1 Pet. 1:18, 19)) a ransom for himself to the LORD, when you number them, that there may be no (2 Sam. 24:15) plague among them when you number them.

(Matt. 17:24) This is what everyone among those who are numbered shall give: half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (Lev. 27:25; Num. 3:47; Ezek. 45:12) (a shekel is twenty gerahs). (Ex. 38:26) The half-shekel shall be an offering to the LORD.
Everyone included among those who are numbered, from twenty years old and above, shall give an offering to the LORD.
The (Job 34:19; Prov. 22:2; (Eph. 6:9)) rich shall not give more and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel, when you give an offering to the LORD, to make atonement for yourselves.

And you shall take the atonement money of the children of Israel, and (Ex. 38:25-31) shall appoint it for the service of the tabernacle of meeting, that it may be (Num. 16:40) a memorial for the children of Israel before the LORD, to make atonement for yourselves.”
(The Bronze Laver) Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

(Ex. 38:8; 1 Kin. 7:38) “You shall also make a laver of bronze, with its base also of bronze, for washing. You shall (Ex. 40:30) put it between the tabernacle of meeting and the altar. And you shall put water in it,
for Aaron and his sons (Ex. 40:31, 32; Ps. 26:6; Is. 52:11; John 13:8, 10; Heb. 10:22) shall wash their hands and their feet in water from it.
When they go into the tabernacle of meeting, or when they come near the altar to minister, to burn an offering made by fire to the LORD, they shall wash with water, lest they die.
So they shall wash their hands and their feet, lest they die. And (Ex. 28:43) it shall be a statute forever to them—to him and his descendants throughout their generations.”
(The Holy Anointing Oil) Moreover the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

“Also take for yourself (Song 4:14; Ezek. 27:22) quality spices—five hundred shekels of liquid (Ps. 45:8; Prov. 7:17) myrrh, half as much sweet-smelling cinnamon (two hundred and fifty shekels), two hundred and fifty shekels of sweet-smelling (Song 4:14; Jer. 6:20) cane,
five hundred shekels of (Ps. 45:8) cassia, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, and a (Ex. 29:40) hin of olive oil.
